definition: psychological warfare/(literary) to be inwardly terrorized
to feed the enemy misinformation through their own spies/to sow discord in the enemy camp
Ambush from Ten Sides (pipa solo piece)/House of Flying Daggers (2004 movie by Zhang Yimou 張藝謀|张艺谋[Zhang1 Yi4 mou2])
the empty city stratagem (in which Zhuge Liang presents himself as unperturbed while making it evident that his city is undefended, hoping his adversary will suspect an ambush)/double bluff
to cache/to hide supplies (from the enemy)
there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
to plan a military mission on a sand table (idiom)/to rehearse a planned action or activity/to conduct a dry run
to cheat/to swindle/to pretend/to feign/to draw sb out/to try to extract information by deceit or bluff
